For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Legal Valuation] 1814 Dec. 12, Natchez, [MS] [for] Col. Joseph Brown
bibl.note: This is a valuation dated Dec. 12, 1814 done for Colonel Joseph Brown. It is evaluating the worth of the decedents of the slave, Sue, that was stolen from Brown's father in 1788 by the Cherokee Chief Cotetoy. These children and grandchildren, know as "Indian Negroes" were returned to Brown by Cotetoy in 1814.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: the Valuation of the Indian Negroes & Expense of the trip to Natchezmisc. math problems
div1.p:
We the Undersigned being Calld on by Col. Joseph Brown to Value the following Negroes hav agreed on the following Prices annexed to Each of their names to wit —
Jenny268.75Lucy268.75
Abernella273.75Doucena161.25
Newchowce213.75OMiah122.50
Watters143.75$ 552.50
Sanallacku83.75923.75
$ 923.75Total$1476.25 and also being Calld on to value a Boy of Col. Joseph Browns by the Name of Sanday hav agreed that he is Worth $267 = 50 = which Boy has been Valued by request of Col. Brown for the purpos of Sending him to the other legalus in place of the two Children of Lucy Given Under Our hands this 12th Day of December 1814
